column4: some one know if it is possible to: ssh -R 21:*:21 user@host ?
my man page says yes
are you shoure the "*" is workin
no0tic, sorry antilpn, my manpage says something different from what i thought i read
oh damn nick completion!
ok
it says you can use "*" in the bind_address, but nothing about the host =/
the problem is with your "*", how will it know which host to connect to?!
maybe you just want -R 21:localhost:21
a remote forward at the momen i can only get it to 127.0.0.1 an then no other computer in the network can connect
what do you actually want to do?
ssh can only forward ports, it can't make a virtual network for you ;)
sry i don't know, it was just an idea ;)
ftpserver that canÂ´t have incoming-c -> router (whith ssh -r) -> and a client connect to this port that is forwarded to router
and you say it works, but only once?
i tried port-forwarding ftp once, but got very stuck
apparently ftp likes to open up other ports!
(unless you use it in a certain mode)
no i can only forward to the routers 127.0.0.1:21 and then i cant connect from other computers
i fear you won't manage it with port forwarding, unless you forward *all* ports FTP might use
ok
